TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ConfigurationSection extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement
Public MustInherit Class ConfigurationSection Inherits ConfigurationElement

span.span: Represents a section within a configuration file.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 您使用类，以实现自定义部分类型。You use the class to implement a custom section type. 扩展类以提供自定义处理和以编程方式访问自定义配置节。Extend the class to provide custom handling and programmatic access to custom configuration sections. 了解如何使用自定义配置节，请参阅[如何： 创建自定义配置部分使用 ConfigurationSection](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/febaca98-c727-4017-95ed-82e2fb6cf234)。For information about how use custom configuration sections, see [How to: Create Custom Configuration Sections Using ConfigurationSection](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/febaca98-c727-4017-95ed-82e2fb6cf234). 部分中的条目注册其处理类型`configSections`元素。A section registers its handling type with an entry in the `configSections` element. 有关示例，请参阅示例部分中所示的配置文件摘录。For an example, see the configuration file excerpt shown in the Example section. > [!NOTE] > 在以前版本的.NET Framework 中，配置节处理程序用于配置设置进行更改以编程方式。In previous versions of the .NET Framework, configuration section handlers were used to make changes to configuration settings programmatically. 现在，通过扩展的类表示所有默认配置段类。Now, all the default configuration sections are represented by classes that extend the class. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何以编程方式实现自定义部分。The following example shows how to implement a custom section programmatically. 有关演示如何实现和使用自定义部分使用特性化的模型实现的完整示例，请参阅。For a complete example that shows how to implement and use a custom section implemented using the attributed model, see . [!code-csharp[System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection/CS/CustomConfigurationSection.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection/VB/CustomConfigurationSection.vb#1)] 下面的示例摘自配置文件适用于前面的示例。The following example is an excerpt of the configuration file as it applies to the previous example. ```xml
```

para.span: 可以使用编程方式或声明性的 （特性化） 编码模型来创建自定义配置部分：

span.span: You can use a programmatic or a declarative (attributed) coding model to create custom configuration sections:

para.span: 编程模型。

span.span: - Programmatic model.

para.span: 此模型需要为每个部分属性创建属性来获取或设置其值并将其添加到的基础的内部属性包基类。

span.span: This model requires that for each section attribute you create a property to get or set its value and add it to the internal property bag of the underlying base class.

para.span: 声明性模型。

span.span: - Declarative model.

para.span: 此更简单的模型，也称为特性化的模型，可以通过使用一个属性，并使用属性修饰来定义的部分属性。

span.span: This simpler model, also called the attributed model, allows you to define a section attribute by using a property and decorating it with attributes.

para.span: 这些属性指示 ASP.NET 配置系统有关的属性类型及其默认值。

span.span: These attributes instruct the ASP.NET configuration system about the property types and their default values.

para.span: 使用此信息，获得通过反射，ASP.NET 配置系统创建属性对象的部分，并执行所需的初始化。

span.span: With this information, obtained through reflection, the ASP.NET configuration system creates the section property objects and performs the required initialization.

para.span: 类可编辑配置文件的编程访问权限。

span.span: The class allows programmatic access for editing configuration files.

para.span: 你可以访问这些文件进行读取或写入，如下所示：

span.span: You can access these files for reading or writing as follows:

para.span: 读取。

span.span: - Reading.

para.span: 您使用或来读取配置信息。

span.span: You use or to read configuration information.

para.span: 请注意的用户或读取的进程必须具有以下权限：

span.span: Note that the user or process that reads must have the following permissions:

para.span: 的当前配置层次结构级别上的配置文件读取权限。

span.span: - Read permission on the configuration file at the current configuration hierarchy level.

para.span: -读取权限的父配置文件。

span.span: - Read permissions on all the parent configuration files.

para.span: 如果你的应用程序需要其自己的配置只读访问，建议你使用重载的方法在 Web 应用程序的情况下或方法在客户端应用程序的情况下。

span.span: If your application needs read-only access to its own configuration, it is recommended you use the overloaded methods in the case of Web applications, or the method in the case of client applications.

para.span: 这些方法提供了访问到当前应用程序的缓存的配置值，它具有更好的性能比类。

span.span: These methods provide access to the cached configuration values for the current application, which has better performance than the class.

para.span: 如果使用静态方法采用参数，参数必须引用的应用程序在其中运行这段代码; 否则，将忽略该参数和当前正在运行的配置信息返回应用程序。

span.span: If you use a static method that takes a parameter, the parameter must refer to the application in which the code is running; otherwise, the parameter is ignored and configuration information for the currently-running application is returned.

para.span: -编写。

span.span: - Writing.

para.span: 使用其中一个方法以编写配置信息。

span.span: You use one of the methods to write configuration information.

para.span: 请注意，将写入的进程的用户必须具有以下权限：

span.span: Note that the user or process that writes must have the following permissions:

para.span: -写入权限的配置文件和当前配置层次结构级别上的目录。

span.span: - Write permission on the configuration file and directory at the current configuration hierarchy level.

para.span: -将读取所有配置文件的权限。

span.span: - Read permissions on all the configuration files.

related.span: ASP.NET 配置 API 概述

span.span: ASP.NET Configuration API Overview

summary.span: 初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要使用构造函数中，您需要首先定义自定义部分类型。To use the constructor, you need to define a custom section type first. 有关示例请参阅类概述。For an example see the class overview. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用 构造函数。The following example shows how to use the constructor. 此示例假定已创建一个名为的自定义部分类`CustomSection`。This example assumes that you have created a custom section class named `CustomSection`. 这样的类的示例，请参阅类概述。For an example of such a class, see the class overview. [!code-csharp[System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection/CS/CustomConfigurationSection.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection/VB/CustomConfigurationSection.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: protected internal virtual void DeserializeSection (System.Xml.XmlReader reader);
.method familyorassemblyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void DeserializeSection(class System.Xml.XmlReader reader) cil managed
Protected Friend Overridable Sub DeserializeSection (reader As XmlReader)
protected public: virtual void DeserializeSection(System::Xml::XmlReader ^ reader);
abstract member DeserializeSection : System.Xml.XmlReader -> unit override this.DeserializeSection : System.Xml.XmlReader -> unit

param.name: reader
param.span: 对象，它从配置文件进行读取。

span.span: The object, which reads from the configuration file.
Reads XML from the configuration file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 反序列化引用从配置文件、 数据转换为实时数据和其存储到一个对象中的读取 XML 数据。Deserialization refers to the reading of XML data from a configuration file, its transformation into real-time data, and its storage in an object.

exception.span: 在配置文件中找不到元素。

span.span: found no elements in the configuration file.

summary.span: 在派生的类中重写时返回自定义对象。

span.span: Returns a custom object when overridden in a derived class.
The object representing the section.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当方法调用在运行时，配置系统首先会创建相应的实例类，并返回它从获取该对象然后方法。When the method is called at run time, the configuration system first creates an appropriate instance of the class, and then returns the object it obtains from the method. 默认情况下只需返回该对象表示从中调用。By default, simply returns the object that represents the from which it is called. ## Examples 下面的示例显示如何使用 方法。The following example shows how to use the method. [!code-csharp[System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection/CS/CustomConfigurationSection.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection/VB/CustomConfigurationSection.vb#4)]

para.span: 您可以重写方法以在运行时返回自定义类型。

span.span: You can override the method to return a custom type at run time.

para.span: 例如，若要限制中的设置运行时修改类，可以重写并返回强制实施的限制在其可以修改设置，如果有自定义类型。

span.span: For example, to restrict runtime modification of the settings in the class, you can override and return a custom type that enforces restrictions on which settings can be modified, if any.

para.span: 如果运行时对象仅在内部，不能定义它的程序集外部使用返回的对象。

span.span: If the runtime object is internal only, the returned object cannot be used outside the assembly that defines it.

para.span: 创建派生的对象的一种方法并且仅可以通过在运行时程序集中的代码访问时将创建具有一个返回方法的内部运行时对象在实现。

span.span: One way to create an object that derives from and can only be accessed by code in your assembly at run time is to create an internal runtime object that has a method that returns your implementation.

span.span: An XML string containing an unmerged view of the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 序列化是指一个对象，为 XML 格式并将其存储到配置文件中包含的实时数据的转换。Serialization refers to the transformation of real-time data, contained in an object, to XML format and its storage to a configuration file.

summary.span: 指示在为 [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] 的指定目标版本序列化配置对象层次结构时，是否应序列化指定元素。

span.span: Indicates whether the specified element should be serialized when the configuration object hierarchy is serialized for the specified target version of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].

returns.span: 如果应序列化 ，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the should be serialized; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 为创建的每个配置节[!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)]及更高版本必须显式重写此方法返回`true`，但前提是指定的元素是有效的指定版本[!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]。Each configuration section that is created for the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)] and later versions must explicitly override this method and return `true`, but only if the specified element is valid for the specified version of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. 早期版本的创建的现有配置节[!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]而无需更改。Existing configuration sections that were created for earlier versions of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] do not have to be changed. 基类型包含的默认实现始终返回此方法的`true`。The base type contains a default implementation of this method that always returns `true`. 如果您实施一个配置节，且不重写此方法，默认情况下在配置部分中包含的所有配置元素将都序列的所有 framework 版本。If you implement a configuration section and you do not override this method, by default all configuration elements that are contained in the configuration section will be serialized for all framework versions.

related.span: 面向 Web 项目的 .NET Framework

span.span: .NET Framework Targeting for Web Projects

MemberSignature.Value: protected internal virtual bool ShouldSerializePropertyInTargetVersion (System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty property, string propertyName, System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName targetFramework, System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement parentConfigurationElement);

summary.span: 指示在为指定目标版本的 [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] 序列化配置对象层次结构时，是否应序列化指定属性。

span.span: Indicates whether the specified property should be serialized when the configuration object hierarchy is serialized for the specified target version of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].

returns.span: 如果应序列化 ，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the should be serialized; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 为创建的每个配置节[!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)]及更高版本必须显式重写此方法返回`true`，但前提是指定的属性是否为指定的版本的有效[!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]。Each configuration section that is created for the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)] and later versions must explicitly override this method and return `true`, but only if the specified property is valid for the specified version of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. 早期版本的创建的现有配置节[!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]而无需更改。Existing configuration sections that were created for earlier versions of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] do not have to be changed. 基类型包含的默认实现始终返回此方法的`true`。The base type contains a default implementation of this method that always returns `true`. 如果您实施一个配置节，且不重写此方法，则默认情况下的配置部分中包含的所有配置属性将为所有的 framework 版本进行序列都化。If you implement a configuration section and you do not override this method, by default all configuration properties that are contained in the configuration section will be serialized for all framework versions.

related.span: 面向 Web 项目的 .NET Framework

span.span: .NET Framework Targeting for Web Projects

span.span: Indicates whether the current instance should be serialized when the configuration object hierarchy is serialized for the specified target version of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].

returns.span: 如果应序列化当前节，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the current section should be serialized; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 为创建的每个配置节[!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)]及更高版本必须显式重写此方法返回`true`，但仅当配置部分是有效的指定版本[!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]。Each configuration section that is created for the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)] and later versions must explicitly override this method and return `true`, but only if the configuration section is valid for the specified version of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. 早期版本的创建的现有配置节[!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]而无需更改。Existing configuration sections that were created for earlier versions of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] do not have to be changed. 基类型包含的默认实现始终返回此方法的`true`。The base type contains a default implementation of this method that always returns `true`. 如果您实施一个配置节，且不重写此方法，则默认情况下的配置节将为所有的 framework 版本进行序列化。If you implement a configuration section and you do not override this method, by default the configuration section will be serialized for all framework versions.

related.span: 面向 Web 项目的 .NET Framework

span.span: .NET Framework Targeting for Web Projects
